title: From Plants to Store Shelves, U.S. Food Supply Is Under Pressure
sub_head: Weeks of workers calling in sick add to continuing supply and transportation disruptions, making store shelves harder to fill
body:
The U.S. food system is under renewed strain as Covid-19â€™s Omicron variant stretches workforces from processing plants to grocery stores, leaving gaps on supermarket shelves.
In Arizona, one in 10 processing plant and distribution workers at a major produce company were recently out sick. In Massachusetts, employee illnesses have slowed the flow of fish to supermarkets and restaurants. A grocery chain in the U.S. Southeast had to hire temporary workers after roughly one-third of employees at its distribution centers fell ill.
